title: Open Educational Practices in Public Higher Education in Portugal: from Theory to Practice
segmentation: OK, so again I'm Paula.

I'm doing my PhD at the Open University of Portugal as I already had a chance to explain and the focus of my research work is open educational practices in public higher education in Portugal from theory to practice.
This is a research I have started in October and unlike some of you here, I don't have any experience in participating in projects, so.

This is a pure interest of research based on abstract research with no hands on experience on the field, and this is one of the main difficulties I have been feeling is exactly the lack of this hands-on experience on specific projects.
So a brief outline of my presentation.
I will start by presenting the problem and describing it very briefly.
Then the research questions and objectives the pertinence, why I chose to do this, and why now abit of the Portuguese context.
What I have found out so far, the conceptual framework in general terms, the research methodology, innovative aspects and the timeline which is already behind.
So as a faculty member myself, I would like to focus on open education in two perspectives.
So I'm a teacher, and I'm also a researcher, so my practice is also two folded.
On one hand we have different movement movements, the open educational practices that comes from the arm movement, and on the other hand the Open Access.
These are two different movements that have had.
Different histories so far, and I would like to consider them together as part of 1 practice of faculty members.
So the idea is to identify and understand the open educational practices and you will see this repeatedly.
Whenever I speak of open educational practices, I always add and emphasize of education and research of teachers, researchers of public higher education institutions in Portugal.
Also, to identify and understand the existence of recommendations, initiatives and public supports in the development of these open educational practices.

So the main research question how are open educational practices of education and research promoted at European and national levels then adopted at institutional level and implemented by teachers, researchers of the public higher education institutions in Portugal and I propose 3 levels of analysis on the 1st macro level.

The objective is to identify the recommendations, initiatives and support of the European Commission and also of the Portuguese Government in the promotion of OEP in the public institutions in Portugal.

Then at a mezzo level at institutional level to characterize the level of openness of the institutions concerning the promotion of these practices in the two perspectives, specifically by analyzing the initiatives, the strategies in place, and if there is any support of these practices and then micro.
Level, which is the main focus to identify and characterize the practices of the teachers and researchers in their contexts.
By analyzing their representations and attitudes towards these practices.
So this is basically what I propose to do.
Why have I chosen this topic and why now and what is there that made me understand that this is relevant?

So in terms of higher education institutions, we all are aware that of the current challenges in terms of lack of students in terms of lack of funding in terms of lack of investment in terms of competition everywhere.
We also realize that there has been an investment in technology.
Especially in terms of management administration, learning management, systems, equipment, and although we're not questioning the benefits of these investments.
The fact is that the paradigm is still the traditional model based on teacher centered and the unidirectional transfer of knowledge so.

summarization_data.sent: OK, so again I'm Paula.

I'm doing my PhD at the Open University of Portugal as I already had a chance to explain and the focus of my research work is open educational practices in public higher education in Portugal from theory to practice.
This is a research I have started in October and unlike some of you here, I don't have any experience in participating in projects, so.

This is a pure interest of research based on abstract research with no hands on experience on the field, and this is one of the main difficulties I have been feeling is exactly the lack of this hands-on experience on specific projects.
So a brief outline of my presentation.
I will start by presenting the problem and describing it very briefly.
Then the research questions and objectives the pertinence, why I chose to do this, and why now abit of the Portuguese context.
What I have found out so far, the conceptual framework in general terms, the research methodology, innovative aspects and the timeline which is already behind.
So as a faculty member myself, I would like to focus on open education in two perspectives.
So I'm a teacher, and I'm also a researcher, so my practice is also two folded.
On one hand we have different movement movements, the open educational practices that comes from the arm movement, and on the other hand the Open Access.
These are two different movements that have had.
Different histories so far, and I would like to consider them together as part of 1 practice of faculty members.
So the idea is to identify and understand the open educational practices and you will see this repeatedly.
Whenever I speak of open educational practices, I always add and emphasize of education and research of teachers, researchers of public higher education institutions in Portugal.
Also, to identify and understand the existence of recommendations, initiatives and public supports in the development of these open educational practices.

So the main research question how are open educational practices of education and research promoted at European and national levels then adopted at institutional level and implemented by teachers, researchers of the public higher education institutions in Portugal and I propose 3 levels of analysis on the 1st macro level.

The objective is to identify the recommendations, initiatives and support of the European Commission and also of the Portuguese Government in the promotion of OEP in the public institutions in Portugal.

Then at a mezzo level at institutional level to characterize the level of openness of the institutions concerning the promotion of these practices in the two perspectives, specifically by analyzing the initiatives, the strategies in place, and if there is any support of these practices and then micro.
Level, which is the main focus to identify and characterize the practices of the teachers and researchers in their contexts.
By analyzing their representations and attitudes towards these practices.
So this is basically what I propose to do.
Why have I chosen this topic and why now and what is there that made me understand that this is relevant?

So in terms of higher education institutions, we all are aware that of the current challenges in terms of lack of students in terms of lack of funding in terms of lack of investment in terms of competition everywhere.
We also realize that there has been an investment in technology.
Especially in terms of management administration, learning management, systems, equipment, and although we're not questioning the benefits of these investments.
The fact is that the paradigm is still the traditional model based on teacher centered and the unidirectional transfer of knowledge so.

The new models of distance education that have come up and specially open education initiatives, which as Fred said a while ago, the books have created the chance of attracting popularity of attracting the attention of the media and the opportunities they create for pedagogical innovation made it made some realize that this is a very good chance.
